result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin F Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 1-1-2016 along with DNA costs. Alternate 20 days jail. Defendant MAY do Community Service in lieu of fine/costs to be done at a rate of $10.00 per hour.
DNA paid along with fine on payment plan
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin F Wallace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kevin F Wallace in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 2. Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine of $694.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 01/01/2016 or alternate of 20 days jail or he may do community service in lieu of paying the fine/costs at the rate of $10.00 a hour thorough WCS.

Defendant Kevin F Wallace in court with attorney Jorge Fragoso for Kelsey Morin.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting the matter will be resolved and set for plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin F Wallace in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for counsel to be appointed. Court adjourns the matter for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kevin F Wallace in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs to pay $60 to the public defendant to obtain counsel.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or Woodman's Food Market listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Kevin F Wallace in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
